definition: to drown oneself by jumping into the river
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: The man tried to byjumping into the river.
Recently I stood by the river and I thought about throwing myself in but I didn't.
sentences.chinese: 最近我站在河邊，想跳河自殺，但是我沒有跳。

sentences.english: Well, if everybody jumped off a bridge, would you jump too?
sentences.chinese: 哦，如果人人都去跳河，你也跟着跳嗎？

sentences.english: "Potential jumpers are very easy to recognize, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 有可能跳河的人很容易看出來。

sentences.english: B: Well, if everybody jumped off a bridge, would you jump too?
sentences.chinese: 哦，如果人人都去跳河，你也跟着跳嗎？

definition: to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to jump from a building (to kill oneself)/fig. to sell at a large discount (in advertising)
to jump into a well (to drown oneself, esp. of ladies in fiction)
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to fall off or jump off a building
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to die together in the name of love/to sacrifice oneself for love
